>@UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.archetypes.Item.HcYYyiTFKmgVu94h]{Fixer}

You know how to cover up information in the real world and on infospheres. When you negotiate with someone to protect a secret, lower the DC of @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.rules.JournalEntry.GMkLZsN3a7YPvA03.JournalEntryPage.GcVVfpQ79HdcMqBt]{Bluff}, @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.rules.JournalEntry.GMkLZsN3a7YPvA03.JournalEntryPage.1tzIBDaDAO4hmX5C]{Diplomacy}, and @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.rules.JournalEntry.GMkLZsN3a7YPvA03.JournalEntryPage.6fqgiVqlA7u9jS4i]{Intimidate} checks you attempt by 5. You can expend 1 Resolve Point to treat the d20 roll in such situations as a 20.

In addition, with special software from your @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.archetype-features.Item.0T8SI1LNoStXl7xa]{cleaner’s kit} and a @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.equipment.Item.N8Aq5n4Tq05r0pvT]{hacker’s kit}, you can expend 1 Resolve Point to find and erase data from one infosphere to which you have access. Doing so takes [[/r 1d4]]{1d4 hours}. The data you erase is limited to a general topic, like that stored on a secure data module (Starfinder Core Rulebook 215), although this ability does not erase data stored on such a module, only from the infosphere itself. The data you erase is only superficially deleted from the infosphere. Data backups restore the information [[/r 1d4+1]]{1d4+1 days} after
